Variable.Name: --RELNST
Variable.Label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
Variable.Description: An opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE."

Variable.Name: --BODSYS
Variable.Label: Body System or Organ Class
Variable.Description: Body system or system organ class from a standard hierarchy (e.g. MedDRA) associated with an event. Example: GASTROINTESTINAL DISORDERS.

Variable.Name: --LOC
Variable.Label: Location of Event
Variable.Description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event. Example: LEFT ARM for skin rash.

Variable.Name: --ACN
Variable.Label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
Variable.Description: Describes changes made to the study treatment as a result of the event. Examples: DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED.

Variable.Name: --ACNOTH
Variable.Label: Other Action Taken
Variable.Description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment.

Variable.Name: --OUT
Variable.Label: Outcome of Event
Variable.Description: Description of the outcome of an event. Examples: RECOVERED/RESOLVED, FATAL.

Variable.Name: --TOX
Variable.Label: Toxicity
Variable.Description: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.

Variable.Name: --DECOD
Variable.Label: Dictionary-Derived Term
Variable.Description: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of the topic variable, --TERM, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA).

Variable.Name: --SOD
Variable.Label: Occurred with Overdose
Variable.Description: Did the event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SHOSP
Variable.Label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
Variable.Description: Did the event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SDTH
Variable.Label: Results in Death
Variable.Description: Did the event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SDISAB
Variable.Label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
Variable.Description: Did the event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SMIE
Variable.Label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
Variable.Description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --MODIFY
Variable.Label: Modified Reported Term
Variable.Description: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

Variable.Name: --SER
Variable.Label: Serious Event
Variable.Description: Is this is a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --REASND
Variable.Label: Reason Not Done
Variable.Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --REL
Variable.Label: Causality
Variable.Description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED.

Variable.Name: --TOXGR
Variable.Label: Toxicity Grade
Variable.Description: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.

Variable.Name: --SEV
Variable.Label: Severity/Intensity
Variable.Description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.

Variable.Name: --TERM
Variable.Label: Reported Term
Variable.Description: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.

Variable.Name: --CAT
Variable.Label: Category
Variable.Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

Variable.Name: --SCAT
Variable.Label: Subcategory
Variable.Description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.

Variable.Name: --PATT
Variable.Label: Pattern of Event
Variable.Description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.

Variable.Name: --STAT
Variable.Label: Completion Status
Variable.Description: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --PRESP
Variable.Label: Pre-specified
Variable.Description: Used to indicate whether the event described by --TERM was pre-specified on a CRF. Value is Y for pre-specified events, null for spontaneously reported events.

Variable.Name: --OCCUR
Variable.Label: Occurrence
Variable.Description: Used to record whether a pre-specified event occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.

Variable.Name: --CONTRT
Variable.Label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
Variable.Description: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SCONG
Variable.Label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
Variable.Description: Was the event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SCAN
Variable.Label: Involves Cancer
Variable.Description: Was the event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --SLIFE
Variable.Label: Is Life Threatening
Variable.Description: Was the event life threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

Variable.Name: --BODSYS
Variable.Label: Body System or Organ Class
Variable.Description: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results. Example: MedDRA SOC.

Variable.Name: --STRESC
Variable.Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
Variable.Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from --ORRES in a standard format or in standard units. --STRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in --STRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in --ORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in --STRESC as "NEGATIVE".

Variable.Name: --SPCCND
Variable.Label: Specimen Condition
Variable.Description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: CLOUDY.

Variable.Name: --SPEC
Variable.Label: Specimen Material Type
Variable.Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE.

Variable.Name: --DTHREL
Variable.Label: Relationship to Death
Variable.Description: Describes the relationship of a particular finding to the death of a subject.

Variable.Name: --SEV
Variable.Label: Severity
Variable.Description: Describes the severity or intensity of a particular finding. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.

Variable.Name: --TOX
Variable.Label: Toxicity
Variable.Description: Description of toxicity quantified by --TOXGR such as NCI CTCAE Short Name. Examples: HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA. Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define.xml document.

Variable.Name: --XFN
Variable.Label: External Filename
Variable.Description: Filename for an external file, such as one for an ECG waveform or a medical image.

Variable.Name: --MODIFY
Variable.Label: Modified Term
Variable.Description: If the value of --ORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

Variable.Name: --LLOQ
Variable.Label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
Variable.Description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for --STRESU.

Variable.Name: --BLFL
Variable.Label: Baseline Flag
Variable.Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null.

Variable.Name: --FAST
Variable.Label: Fasting Status
Variable.Description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include Y, N, U or null if not relevant.

Variable.Name: --LOC
Variable.Label: Location Used for the Measurement
Variable.Description: Location relevant to the collection of the measurement. Example: RECTAL for temperature, LEFT ARM for blood pressure or V1 for an ECG lead.

Variable.Name: --LOINC
Variable.Label: LOINC Code
Variable.Description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.

Variable.Name: --TEST
Variable.Label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
Variable.Description: Long name For --TESTCD. Examples: Platelet, Systolic Blood Pressure, Summary (Min) RR Duration, Eye Examination.

Variable.Name: --ORNRLO
Variable.Label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
Variable.Description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.

Variable.Name: --STNRLO
Variable.Label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
Variable.Description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).

Variable.Name: --METHOD
Variable.Label: Method of Test or Examination
Variable.Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: EIA (Enzyme Immunoassay), ELECTROPHORESIS, DIPSTICK.

Variable.Name: --NAM
Variable.Label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
Variable.Description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Variable.Name: --STNRC
Variable.Label: Normal Range for Character Results
Variable.Description: Normal range or reference range for results stored in --STRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: Negative to Trace.

Variable.Name: --POS
Variable.Label: Position of Subject During Observation
Variable.Description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: SUPINE, STANDING, SITTING.

Variable.Name: --REASND
Variable.Label: Reason Not Done
Variable.Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --TOXGR
Variable.Label: Toxicity Grade
Variable.Description: Records toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define data definition document. Example: 2.

Variable.Name: --ORRES
Variable.Label: Result or Finding in Original Units
Variable.Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: 120, <1, POS.

Variable.Name: --EVAL
Variable.Label: Evaluator
Variable.Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR.

Variable.Name: --TESTCD
Variable.Label: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
Variable.Description: Short character value for --TEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: PLAT, SYSBP, RRMIN, EYEEXAM.

Variable.Name: --STRESU
Variable.Label: Standard Units
Variable.Description: Standardized units used for --STRESC and --STRESN. Example: mol/L.

Variable.Name: --ORRESU
Variable.Label: Original Units
Variable.Description: Unit for --ORRES. Examples: IN, LB, kg/L.

Variable.Name: --ORNRHI
Variable.Label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
Variable.Description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in --ORRES.

Variable.Name: --STNRHI
Variable.Label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
Variable.Description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., --STRESC, --STRESN) represented in standardized units (--STRESU).

Variable.Name: --STRESN
Variable.Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
Variable.Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

Variable.Name: --RESCAT
Variable.Label: Result Category
Variable.Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Example: MALIGNANT or BENIGN for tumor findings.

Variable.Name: --CAT
Variable.Label: Category
Variable.Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: HEMATOLOGY, URINALYSIS, CHEMISTRY, HAMILTON DEPRESSION SCALE, SF36.

Variable.Name: --SCAT
Variable.Label: Subcategory
Variable.Description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values. Example: DIFFERENTIAL.

Variable.Name: --DRVFL
Variable.Label: Derived Flag
Variable.Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be Y or null.

Variable.Name: --STAT
Variable.Label: Completion Status
Variable.Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --NRIND
Variable.Label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
Variable.Description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by --ORNRLO and --ORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL; ABNORMAL.

Variable.Name: --OBJ
Variable.Label: Object of the Observation
Variable.Description: Used in domains modeled as Findings About Events or Findings About Interventions. Describes the event or intervention whose property is being measured in --TESTCD/--TEST. Example: an event of vomiting which has findings, where --OBJ = "VOMIT" and the volume of VOMIT is being measured where --TESTCD = "VOLUME".

Variable.Name: USUBJID
Variable.Label: Unique Subject Identifier
Variable.Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

Variable.Name: --GRPID
Variable.Label: Group ID
Variable.Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset.

Variable.Name: --REFID
Variable.Label: Reference ID
Variable.Description: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID, or UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image.

Variable.Name: --SEQ
Variable.Label: Sequence Number
Variable.Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. Should be assigned to be in a consistent chronological order.

Variable.Name: --SPID
Variable.Label: Sponsor ID
Variable.Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.

Variable.Name: DOMAIN
Variable.Label: Domain Abbreviation
Variable.Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The Domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.

Variable.Name: STUDYID
Variable.Label: Study Identifier
Variable.Description: Unique identifier for a study.

Variable.Name: --DOSE
Variable.Label: Dose
Variable.Description: Amount of --TRT given. Not populated when --DOSTXT is populated.

Variable.Name: --VAMT
Variable.Label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
Variable.Description: Amount of the treatment vehicle administered or given.

Variable.Name: --LOC
Variable.Label: Location of Dose Administration
Variable.Description: Anatomical location of an intervention, such as an injection site. Example: RIGHT ARM for an injection.

Variable.Name: --CLAS
Variable.Label: Class
Variable.Description: Class for a medication or treatment, often obtained from a coding dictionary.

Variable.Name: --INDC
Variable.Label: Indication
Variable.Description: Denotes the indication for the intervention (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered).

Variable.Name: --ADJ
Variable.Label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
Variable.Description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples ADVERSE EVENT, INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE, NON-MEDICAL REASON.

Variable.Name: --DOSFRM
Variable.Label: Dose Form
Variable.Description: Dose form for the treatment. Examples: TABLET, CAPSULE.

Variable.Name: --DOSTXT
Variable.Label: Dose Description
Variable.Description: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: <1 per day, 200-400. Not populated when --DOSE is populated.

Variable.Name: --MODIFY
Variable.Label: Modified Treatment Name
Variable.Description: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

Variable.Name: --LOT
Variable.Label: Lot Number
Variable.Description: Lot number for the intervention described in --TRT.

Variable.Name: --REASND
Variable.Label: Reason Not Done
Variable.Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with --STAT when value is NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --ROUTE
Variable.Label: Route of Administration
Variable.Description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.

Variable.Name: --DECOD
Variable.Label: Standardized Treatment Name
Variable.Description: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of the topic variable, --TRT, or the modified topic variable (--MODIFY), if applicable. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries.

Variable.Name: --DOSRGM
Variable.Label: Intended Dose Regimen
Variable.Description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.

Variable.Name: --TRT
Variable.Label: Name of Treatment
Variable.Description: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the verbatim name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.

Variable.Name: --DOSTOT
Variable.Label: Total Daily Dose
Variable.Description: Total daily dose of --TRT using the units in --DOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose.

Variable.Name: --DOSU
Variable.Label: Dose Units
Variable.Description: Units for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT (Examples: ng, mg, mg/kg).

Variable.Name: --VAMTU
Variable.Label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
Variable.Description: Units for the treatment vehicle. Examples: mL, mg.

Variable.Name: --CAT
Variable.Label: Category
Variable.Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

Variable.Name: --SCAT
Variable.Label: Subcategory
Variable.Description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.

Variable.Name: --STAT
Variable.Label: Completion Status
Variable.Description: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a pre-specified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

Variable.Name: --OCCUR
Variable.Label: Occurrence
Variable.Description: Used to record whether a pre-specified intervention occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.

Variable.Name: --CLASCD
Variable.Label: Class Code
Variable.Description: Used to represent code for --CLAS.

Variable.Name: --PRESP
Variable.Label: Pre-specified
Variable.Description: Used when a specific intervention is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.

Variable.Name: --DOSFRQ
Variable.Label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
Variable.Description: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval. Examples: QD, BID, TID, QID.

Variable.Name: --TRTV
Variable.Label: Treatment Vehicle
Variable.Description: Vehicle for administration of treatment, such as a liquid in which the treatment drug is dissolved. Example: SALINE.

Variable.Name: --ENDY
Variable.Label: Study Day of End of Observation
Variable.Description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

Variable.Name: --STDY
Variable.Label: Study Day of Start of Observation
Variable.Description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

Variable.Name: --DY
Variable.Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
Variable.Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

Variable.Name: VISITNUM
Variable.Label: Visit Number
Variable.Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

Variable.Name: --DUR
Variable.Label: Duration
Variable.Description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

Variable.Name: --DTC
Variable.Label: Date/Time of Collection
Variable.Description: Collection date and time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

Variable.Name: --RFTDTC
Variable.Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
Variable.Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

Variable.Name: --TPTREF
Variable.Label: Time Point Reference
Variable.Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.

Variable.Name: --ENTPT
Variable.Label: End Reference Time Point
Variable.Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --ENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".

Variable.Name: --STTPT
Variable.Label: Start Reference Time Point
Variable.Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".

Variable.Name: --ENDTC
Variable.Label: End Date/Time of Observation
Variable.Description: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

Variable.Name: EPOCH
Variable.Label: Epoch
Variable.Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

Variable.Name: --EVLINT
Variable.Label: Evaluation Interval
Variable.Description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: -P2M to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval for a question from a questionnaire such as SF-36.

Variable.Name: --ENRTPT
Variable.Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
Variable.Description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --ENTPT.

Variable.Name: --ENRF
Variable.Label: End Relative to Reference Period
Variable.Description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before, during or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

Variable.Name: --STRTPT
Variable.Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
Variable.Description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT.

Variable.Name: --STRF
Variable.Label: Start Relative to Reference Period
Variable.Description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before, during, or after the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics.

Variable.Name: TAETORD
Variable.Label: Planned Order of Elements within Arm
Variable.Description: Number that gives the planned order of the Element within the Arm.

Variable.Name: --TPTNUM
Variable.Label: Planned Time Point Number
Variable.Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

Variable.Name: --ELTM
Variable.Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
Variable.Description: Planned Elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (--TPTREF) such as "Previous Dose" or "Previous Meal". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

Variable.Name: VISITDY
Variable.Label: Planned Study Day of Visit
Variable.Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

Variable.Name: VISIT
Variable.Label: Visit Name
Variable.Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

Variable.Name: --STDTC
Variable.Label: Start Date/Time of Observation
Variable.Description: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

Variable.Name: --TPT
Variable.Label: Planned Time Point Name
Variable.Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
